iati-activity.title: Community Nutrition In Malawi
iati-activity.description: The Government of Malawi through the Department of Nutrition, HIV and AIDS (DNHA) in the Office of the President and Cabinet (OPC) has received financing towards the cost of the Nutrition, HIV and AIDS Project (NHAP). The Nutrition Project aims at contributing to the reduction of child stunting, maternal and child anemia in Malawi by: (i) enhancing and scaling up maternal and child nutrition (SUN) service delivery at community level and (ii) strengthening sectoral policy and program development, management and coordination at central, district and community levels.

contact-info.mailing-address: 1 St. John's Lane, London EC1M 4AR, UK

iati-activity.collaboration-type: Bilateral, core contributions to NGOs and other private bodies / PPPs
iati-activity.default-aid-type: Contributions to specific-purpose programmes and funds managed by international organisations (multilateral, INGO)

iati-activity.title: Malawi Climatic Shocks
iati-activity.description: The aim of this project is to provide immediate life-saving essential agricultural inputs to ensure successful production in the approaching season by 5,500 food insecure households affected by climatic shocks in the previous season. This project will also provide, by May 2014, essential tailor made training packages that would ensure successful crop production and enable the targeted 5,500 farming households to better cope with future shocks associated with floods or drought.

contact-info.mailing-address: 1 St. John's Lane, London EC1M 4AR, UK

iati-activity.title: Humanitarian Assistance and Resilience
iati-activity.description: The aim of this project is to support the affected vulnerable individuals to protect them against hunger, malnutrition and use of negative coping strategies. The proposed project seeks to improve lives, reduce suffering, and build resilience of drought affected households, food insecure vulnerable households to cope by facilitating access to financial assistance and improving their resilience to future shocks and disasters. The project will implement economic recovery interventions such as financial assistance, market linkage, and financial services, to address immediate food needs and at the same time build the capacity of the vulnerable community members to withstand shocks and disasters.

contact-info.mailing-address: 1 St. John's Lane, London EC1M 4AR, UK
